org.fluentjava.collections
Interface ExtendedCollection<E>

Type Parameters:
E -
All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Collection<E>, java.lang.Iterable<E>
All Known Subinterfaces:
FluentList<E>, FluentSet<E>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExtendedSet, ForwardingFluentList, ForwardingFluentSet, Sequence
public interface ExtendedCollection<E>
extends java.util.Collection<E>

Collection that accepts varargs for: Collection.containsAll(Collection), Collection.removeAll(Collection), Collection.retainAll(Collection), Collection.addAll(Collection). Also, has a toArray method that accepts a Class instead of an array. Also, introduces containsAny, with both varargs and collection arguments.

Method Summary

          Convenient varargs call to Collection.addAll(Collection).

array

<T> T[] array(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
Similar to the method toArray, but receives no args and is type safe. Also, the returned array is just a copy. Note that the class is necessary, as Generics by themselves cannot solve this problem alone. For more info: http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-jtp01255.html

Returns:
A copy of the list as an array.
